intro: Grosourdya leytensis, commonly known as the Leyte trumpetflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of red and orange, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. Its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the branches, and the plant is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. Grosourdya leytensis is valued for its ornamental qualities and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
